contents.name: Figure Me.01 - Basic Metric Definition Entities
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Common Domain::Metric ABE::Metric Addendum Figures::Figure Me.01 - Basic Metric Definition Entities

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: The core entity in the ABE is MetricDefinition. It provides basic facts that define or specify what a metric is, such as the name, description, and so forth. Any entity in the SID can be measured. The association between MetricDefinition and RootEntityType provides this capability. Instances of RootEntityType represent all the entities in the SID model. The *-* association between these two entities allows the same definition to be used to measure any number of entities in the SID model and for a SID entity to be measured by any number of definitions....

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.01 - Basic Metric Definition Entities

ownedComment.body: The core entity in the ABE is MetricDefinition. It provides basic facts that define or specify what a metric is, such as the name, description, and so forth. Any entity in the SID can be measured. The association between MetricDefinition and RootEntityType provides this capability. Instances of RootEntityType represent all the entities in the SID model. The *-* association between these two entities allows the same definition to be used to measure any number of entities in the SID model and for a SID entity to be measured by any number of definitions. The definition of a metric can also be categorized, such as a business metric, a fraud metric, a revenue assurance metric. The association to MetricDefintionCategory allows many different categorizations of a MetricDefinition via the *-* association. .The recursive association on MetricDefinition enables categories to be divided into sub-categories as needed, such as a revenue sub-category of a business metric or a profitability category of a business metric. MetDefBusinessValue enables multiple relative business values to be associated to the MetricDefinition, such as revenue benefit, cost benefit, efficiency, customer experience, time to market, and so forth.

contents.name: Figure Me.06 - Metric Definition Using Characteristics
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Common Domain::Metric ABE::Metric Addendum Figures::Figure Me.06 - Metric Definition Using Characteristics

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: There is often the need to add additional attributes to the definition of a metric or to add attributes that are specific to an instance of a metric. Figure Me.06 – Metric Definition Using Characteristics shows how the Characteristic model can be used to support this requirement. More information on Characteristics can be found in the Root Business Entities guide book.

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.06 - Metric Definition Using Characteristics

ownedComment.body: There is often the need to add additional attributes to the definition of a metric or to add attributes that are specific to an instance of a metric. Figure Me.06 – Metric Definition Using Characteristics shows how the Characteristic model can be used to support this requirement. More information on Characteristics can be found in the Root Business Entities guide book.

contents.name: Figure Me.04 - Metric Definition Hierarchy
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Common Domain::Metric ABE::Metric Addendum Figures::Figure Me.04 - Metric Definition Hierarchy

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.04 – Metric Definition Hierarchy shows how hierarchies of metrics are represented....

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.04 - Metric Definition Hierarchy

ownedComment.body: Figure Me.04 – Metric Definition Hierarchy shows how hierarchies of metrics are represented. MetricDefinitions can be related to one another in a variety of ways. One way is in a hierarchy of definitions, such as a calculation hierarchy. MetricDefinitionHierarchy provides the ability to define any number of hierarchical relationships. MetricDefinitionHierarchyMember represents the relationship between two MetricDefinitions in a hierarchy, one playing the parent role and the other playing the role of a child. For example, video sessions, with a synthetic scalar metric such as an estimated MOS (Mean Opinion Score), a number between 1 and 5; the per-session MOS KPI is computed using different low-level counters (packet loss, delay, delay variation, NE port-level frame counters, and so forth. Another type of relationship could indicate one MetricDefinition has been replaced by another or could be used instead of another.

contents.name: Figure Me.03 - Metric Definition Description and Dimension
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Common Domain::Metric ABE::Metric Addendum Figures::Figure Me.03 - Metric Definition Description and Dimension

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.03 – Metric Definition Description shows how a MetricDefinition’s description can be extended as well as dimensional attributes that define a Metric....

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.03 - Metric Definition Description and Dimension

ownedComment.body: Figure Me.03 – Metric Definition Description shows how a MetricDefinition’s description can be extended as well as dimensional attributes that define a Metric. The MetDefDescExtension entity enables additional descriptive text, such as references and owner notes, to be defined for a MetricDefinition. The metDefType attribute specifies the type of descriptive text contained in the descriptionExtension attribute. The four dimension related entities provide the ability to designate methods of organizing individual metrics into common sets, related by the value of the named dimension. For example, a metric for revenue–individual instance values of revenue could be organized in the dimension of geography (Region 1 Revenues, Region 2 Revenues, etc.), or by Product (Wireless Revenue, Wire-line Revenue, Broadband Revenue, Advertising Revenue, etc.). The characteristic term when describing dimension is “by”, as in “Revenue, by Product” or “Revenue, by Region”.

contents.name: Figure Me.05 - Metric Definition Involvement
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Common Domain::Metric ABE::Metric Addendum Figures::Figure Me.05 - Metric Definition Involvement

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: Many different parties can be involved with the definition of a metric. Figure Me.05 – Metric Definition Involvement shows the part of the model that represents this involvement....

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.05 - Metric Definition Involvement

ownedComment.body: Many different parties can be involved with the definition of a metric. Figure Me.05 – Metric Definition Involvement shows the part of the model that represents this involvement. A Party independent of the role they play can be involved or a role played by a party (PartyRole) can be involved. The involvementType attribute of MetricDefinitionInvolvement specifies the type of involvement, such as the source, user, owner, defining authority of the MetricDefinition.

contents.name: Figure Me.02 - Metric Definition Measure
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Common Domain::Metric ABE::Metric Addendum Figures::Figure Me.02 - Metric Definition Measure

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: Two entities, MetricDefinitionDeterminationMethod and MetricDefinitionMethodArgument support this requirement. Basic facts about the method, such a type (ratio, sum, and so forth) are contained in the MetricDefinitionDeterminationMethod. The arguments that represent the expression are contained in one or more MetricDefinitionMethodArgument. An argument may be the same or another MetricDefinition. For example, a simple ratio of metric definition A divided by metric definition B would be represented by two instances of the arguments. The numerator would be related to metric definition A with a sequence of 1 and an operator of “/”. The denominator would be related to metric definition B with a sequence of 2....

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.02 - Metric Definition Measure

ownedComment.body: Two entities, MetricDefinitionDeterminationMethod and MetricDefinitionMethodArgument support this requirement. Basic facts about the method, such a type (ratio, sum, and so forth) are contained in the MetricDefinitionDeterminationMethod. The arguments that represent the expression are contained in one or more MetricDefinitionMethodArgument. An argument may be the same or another MetricDefinition. For example, a simple ratio of metric definition A divided by metric definition B would be represented by two instances of the arguments. The numerator would be related to metric definition A with a sequence of 1 and an operator of “/”. The denominator would be related to metric definition B with a sequence of 2. The delimiter attribute, such as “(“ and “)”, enables more complex expressions. For example (metric definition A + metric definition C). When an expression is too complex to represent using the arguments, such as one that includes logic and using other entities) the derivationFormula attribute can contain a reference to logic (code) that performs the calculation. Remark: An implementation of the model may choose to share same determination method for many metric definition measures. If this is the case then the association would be changed to *-*.

contents.name: Figure Me.01a - Metric Definition and Specifications
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Common Domain::Metric ABE::Metric Addendum Figures::Figure Me.01a - Metric Definition and Specifications

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: MetricDefinition can be defined for any type of entity that a Metric measures (therefore the association to RootEntityType). The SID uses the EntitySpec/Entity pattern to dynamically instantiate entities. MetricDefinition is used to measure these dynamically defined entities. Therefore the association to Specification (as a base class to ResourceSpec and ServiceSpec) has been included as shown in Figure Me.01a – Metric Definition and Specifications....

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.01a - Metric Definition and Specifications

ownedComment.body: MetricDefinition can be defined for any type of entity that a Metric measures (therefore the association to RootEntityType). The SID uses the EntitySpec/Entity pattern to dynamically instantiate entities. MetricDefinition is used to measure these dynamically defined entities. Therefore the association to Specification (as a base class to ResourceSpec and ServiceSpec) has been included as shown in Figure Me.01a – Metric Definition and Specifications. There is also option to extend the model by associating MetricDefinition with other entity specifications. Examples for ProductSpec and PerformanceSpec are shown. MetricDefinition has been sub-classed to explicitly show these two types of MetricDefintions. From an implementation perspective they can be rolled up into MetricDefintion if desired, or MetricDefinition could be rolled down into them. Often application boundaries dictate which of the two approaches to take. Metrics may be calculated in a number of different ways from a simple ratio to a complex expression. Figure Me.02 – Metric Definition Measure shows the entities used to calculate a metric value.

contents.name: Figure Me.07c - Metric Threshold Definition
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Common Domain::Metric ABE::Metric Addendum Figures::Figure Me.07c - Metric Threshold Definition

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.07c - Metric Threshold Definition shows the detailed view of how threshold are specified for a MetricDefMeasure.

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.07c - Metric Threshold Definition

ownedComment.body: Figure Me.07c - Metric Threshold Definition shows the detailed view of how threshold are specified for a MetricDefMeasure.

contents.name: Figure Me.10 - Metric Measure Definition Groups
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Common Domain::Metric ABE::Metric Addendum Figures::Figure Me.10 - Metric Measure Definition Groups

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.10 - Metric Measure Definition Groups shows how MetricDefMeasures and MetricMeasures may be grouped when needed....

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.10 - Metric Measure Definition Groups

ownedComment.body:
Figure Me.10 - Metric Measure Definition Groups shows how MetricDefMeasures and MetricMeasures may be grouped when needed.
A MetricDefMeasureGroup is a set of MetricDefMeasures, usually reported in the same message by the equipment or the EMS. A MetricMeasureGroup is a set of MetricMeasures, usually reported in the same message by the equipment or the EMS.

contents.name: Figure Me.08 - Metric Definition Measure Threshold Rule
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Common Domain::Metric ABE::Metric Addendum Figures::Figure Me.08 - Metric Definition Measure Threshold Rule

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.08 - Metric Definition Measure Threshold Rule shows the different types of threshold rules that might be defined....

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.08 - Metric Definition Measure Threshold Rule

ownedComment.body:
Figure Me.08 - Metric Definition Measure Threshold Rule shows the different types of threshold rules that might be defined. A MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule is a rule that defines the condition (raise or clear) to achieve to apply consequences when a threshold (MetricDefMeasureThreshold) is crossed or ceased to be crossed. It may behave in one of two different ways: • Either it provides attributes for various kinds of threshold logic definition (MetricThresholdRuleDefinition), • or it is defined by a derivation algorithm that represents a predefined logic that can be executed with parameters (PreDefinedMetricThresholdRule).
A MetricThresholdRuleDefinition specifies the threshold range of values (lower and upper conformance target) with comparators (lower and upper comparator), tolerances and, grace periods, and a comparator. Each comparator is an operator that specifies whether MetricDefMeasureThresholdSet is crossed when it is above or below a conformance target. For example, a threshold may specify that when average lost packets indicator exceeds a value of 2000 and is under 3000, then the threshold is crossed.
A PreDefinedMetricThresholdRule is a "blackbox" logic and is defined by a named predefined logic that can be executed with parameters. Therefore the PreDefinedMetricThresholdRule entity will hold the rule name, and the PreDefinedMetricThresholdRuleParam will define the parameters that are required for executing the PreDefinedMetricThresholdRule. As these parameters are often indicator specifications, they can be associated to the MetricDefMeasure entity.

contents.name: Figure Me.09 - Metric Measure Notification definition
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Common Domain::Metric ABE::Metric Addendum Figures::Figure Me.09 - Metric Measure Notification definition

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: Different kinds of consequences may be applied as a consequence of threshold. Figure Me.09 - Metric Measure Notification definition shows how to describe notification consequences....

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.09 - Metric Measure Notification definition

ownedComment.body:
Different kinds of consequences may be applied as a consequence of threshold. Figure Me.09 - Metric Measure Notification definition shows how to describe notification consequences.
A MetricDefMeasureConsequence either results in a prescribed action (prescribedAction) or one or more ConsequenceMetricNotificationSpecs.
If a MetricMeasureConsequence is triggered by a MetricMeasure (through a MetricMeasureThresholfRule) according to a MetricDefMeasureConsequence and the MetricDefMeasureConsequence results in ConsequenceMetricNotificationSpecs, then a ConsequenceMetricNotification is created for each of them. A ConsequenceMetricNotification is a type of ConsequenceMetricNotification, which in turn is a type of Notification. A ConsequenceMetricNotification is described by a ConsequenceMetricNotificationSpec.
Note: To be consistent with the pattern Specifcation used for ConsequenceMetricNotificationSpec / ConsequenceMetricNotification, a NotificationSpecification should exist in the Business Interaction ABE. This concept would specify the content pattern for each corresponding notification.

contents.name: Figure Me.11 - Metric Measurement Job
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Common Domain::Metric ABE::Metric Addendum Figures::Figure Me.11 - Metric Measurement Job

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.11 – Metric Measurement Job shows how to define jobs to measure MetricDefMeasures and MetricDefMeasureGroups....

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.11 - Metric Measurement Job

ownedComment.body:
Figure Me.11 – Metric Measurement Job shows how to define jobs to measure MetricDefMeasures and MetricDefMeasureGroups.
A MetricManagementJob is a management activity that may consist of several steps but is performed as a single logical unit in a Metric context. It can be a one-time activity or a regular one. In the latter case, a schedule definition is attached to it.
A MetricMeasurementJob always defines a scope of monitored objects using the MonitoredMetricObjectCriteria. A MetricDefMeasure as well as a MetricDefMeasureGroup may be measured by one or more MetricMeasurementJob.

contents.name: Figure Me.12 - Monitored Metric Object Criterion
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Common Domain::Metric ABE::Metric Addendum Figures::Figure Me.12 - Monitored Metric Object Criterion

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.12 - Monitored Metric Object Criterion shows the different types of MonitoredMetricObjectCriterion....

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.12 - Monitored Metric Object Criterion

ownedComment.body:
Figure Me.12 - Monitored Metric Object Criterion shows the different types of MonitoredMetricObjectCriterion.
A MonitoredMetricObjectCriterion defines the scope of monitored objects for which a MeasurementJob is executed. The scope is either defined: • by a filter on a Class (sub-class MonitoredMetricClassCriterion) • or by a list of instances (sub-class MonitoredMetricInstanceCriterion).
A MonitoredMetricClassCriterion is a type of MonitoredMetricObjectCriterion. It defines the scope of monitored objects for which a MeasurementJob is executed.by a filter on a class through the relationship with RootEntityType.
A MonitoredMetricInstanceCriterion is a type of MonitoredMetricObjectCriterion. It defines the scope of monitored objects for which a MeasurementJob is executed by a list of instances through the relationship with one or several RootEntity instances.

contents.name: Figure Me.16 - Basic Metric Measure Entities
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Common Domain::Metric ABE::Metric Addendum Figures::Figure Me.16 - Basic Metric Measure Entities

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: Once metrics are defined the values associated with them can be captured. Figure Me.21 – Metric shows the MetricMeasure entity and its directly related entities....

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.16 - Basic Metric Measure Entities

ownedComment.body: Once metrics are defined the values associated with them can be captured. Figure Me.21 – Metric shows the MetricMeasure entity and its directly related entities. The MetricMeasure might be collected for 0..1 RootEntity because some entities may be explicitly related to a MetricMeasure, such as those entities currently in the Performance, including Service and Resource, and SLA entities, including ProductOffering and ServiceSpecification. These explicit associations represent a more detailed association than the more general association to RootEntity. This diagram uses RootEntity as an abstract concept showing how any entity can be associated to MetricMeasure. Since RootEntity is also a real class in the SID model and is the base class of several ABEs (Resource, ResourceSpec, Service, ServiceSpec and Policy) this diagram also includes examples on how to model Metrics that measure entities which are not subclasses of RootEntity in the SID model. For example, suppose there is a need to collect a metric for the Service instance of RootEntityType. The first step is to select one of the MetricDefinition(s) for it, then the MetricDefMeasure to use, then the MetricDefinitionDeterminationMethod. The MetricMeasure is associated to the method and to RootEntity (not RootEntityType) that represents for example the instance of Service for which the MetricMeasure is being collected. There are indirect associations (i.e. derived) from the MetricMeasure to the MetricDefMeasure via the association to MetricDefinitionDeterminationMethod and from MetricMeasure to MetricDefinition via its association to MetricDefMeasure.

contents.name: Figure Me.17 - Metric Threshold
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Common Domain::Metric ABE::Metric Addendum Figures::Figure Me.17 - Metric Threshold

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: A MetricDefMeasure specifies a measure of a specific aspect of an entity, such as lost packets or dealer sales target achievement, defined for a MetricDefinition that may trigger consequence (s) (MetricDefMeasureConsequence) if a threshold (MetricDefMeasureThreshold) is crossed....

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.17 - Metric Threshold

ownedComment.body: A MetricDefMeasure specifies a measure of a specific aspect of an entity, such as lost packets or dealer sales target achievement, defined for a MetricDefinition that may trigger consequence (s) (MetricDefMeasureConsequence) if a threshold (MetricDefMeasureThreshold) is crossed. A MetricMeasure is a numerical value or text determined for a MetricDefMeasure that may be collected for a RootEntity, such as a connection or a dealer. A MetricDefMeasureThresholdSet provides a way to group a set of one or more MetricDefMeasureThresholdRules specifying the condition to evaluate for applying consequences. A MetricDefMeasureThresholdSet is used to evaluate one or more MetricDefMesures. Threshold rules (MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule) may differ in the condition that they apply, a raise condition or a clear condition, and in the severity of the threshold crossing. A MetricDefMeasureConsequence defines the action taken when a MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule is crossed. Different consequences (MetricDefMeasureConsequence) can be defined for different severities. A MetricMeasureThresholdRule specifies the MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule whose threshold has been crossed by a MetricMeasure. It triggers one or more MetricMeasureConsequences.For example, the prescribed action by a consequence might be to monitor the MetricMeasure more closely or to notify a specific person or the lost packets MetricMeasure with a value of 2500 would be associated with the threshold of no more than 2000 lost packets through a MetricMeasureThresholdRule.

contents.name: Figure Me.13 - Metric Threshold Job and MetricDefMeasureThresholdSet
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Common Domain::Metric ABE::Metric Addendum Figures::Figure Me.13 - Metric Threshold Job and MetricDefMeasureThresholdSet

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.13 – Metric Threshold Job and MetricDefMeasureThresholdSet shows the different types of MetricMeasurementJob....

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.13 - Metric Threshold Job and MetricDefMeasureThresholdSet

ownedComment.body:
Figure Me.13 – Metric Threshold Job and MetricDefMeasureThresholdSet shows the different types of MetricMeasurementJob.
A MetricMeasurementJob may be • either a job for evaluating thresholds defined over MetricDefMeasure (MetricMeasurementThresholdJob), • a job for producing MetricMesures according to a MetricDefMeasure (MetricMeasurementProductionJob), • a job for collecting MetricMeasures produced by another job (MetricMeasurementCollectionJob), • or a job for collecting MetricMeasures produced by another job to make available MetricMeasures for subscribers. (AdhocMetricCollection).
A MetricMeasurementThresholdJob evaluates one MetricDefMeasureThresholdSet.
A MetricMeasurementJob defines a scope of monitored objects using the MonitoredMetricObjectCriteria. A MetricMeasurementJob also defines a scope of monitored objects using the MonitoredMetricClassCriteria.

contents.name: Figure Me.14 - Metric Applicabilty
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Common Domain::Metric ABE::Metric Addendum Figures::Figure Me.14 - Metric Applicabilty

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: A MetricDefMeasure, MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule or even MetricDefMeasureConsequence might applicable only during certain periods....

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.14 - Metric Applicabilty

ownedComment.body: A MetricDefMeasure, MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule or even MetricDefMeasureConsequence might applicable only during certain periods. In this case, the MetricDefMeasureApplicability is used to specify in detail each applicable period. The MetricDefMeasureApplicability represents the time of day or days during which a MetricDefMeasure, MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule or even MetricDefMeasureConsequence are measurable or not. The applicableCode attribute Indicates whether an instance represents applicability or un-applicability.

contents.name: Figure Me.15 - Metric Measure Definition Expression
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Common Domain::Metric ABE::Metric Addendum Figures::Figure Me.15 - Metric Measure Definition Expression

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: The Figure Me.15 - Metric Measure Definition Expression shows how the relationships with MetricDefMeasures might be refined....

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.15 - Metric Measure Definition Expression

ownedComment.body: The Figure Me.15 - Metric Measure Definition Expression shows how the relationships with MetricDefMeasures might be refined. For example, a MetricDefMeasureExpression might enable specifying a specific period of applicability or un-applicability (MetricDefMeasureApplicability) for MetricDefMeasureConsequence and / or MetricDefMeasureDefMeasureThresholdRule in the context of a specific MetricDefMeasure. This capability is useful as MetricDefMeasureConsequence and MetricDefMeasureDefMeasureThresholdRule are reusable by several MetricDefMeasure.

contents.name: Figure Me.07b - Metric Definition Threshold Associations
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Common Domain::Metric ABE::Metric Addendum Figures::Figure Me.07b - Metric Definition Threshold Associations

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.07b - Metric Definition Threshold Associations shows the detailed associations for MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule....

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.07b - Metric Definition Threshold Associations

ownedComment.body: Figure Me.07b - Metric Definition Threshold Associations shows the detailed associations for MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule. The MetricDefMeasureThreshConsDependency specifies the type of dependency that may exist between MetricDefMeasureConsequence and MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule. For example, "the consequence is triggered only if the rule has been applied previously", or "if the rule has already been applied then do not trigger the consequence". The two associations MetricDefMeasureConsequenceDependentUpon, MetricDefMeasureThresholdRuleDefines and the entity MetricDefMeasureThreshConsDependency are summarized through the derived association “/MetricDefMeasureConsequenceDependsOn” on the Figure Me.07a - Metric Threshold Definition - Derived Associations. The MetricDefMeasureThresholdConsequence specifies the sequence of application when several MetricDefMeasureConsequence have to be applied for a specific MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule. The two associations MetricDefMeasureThresholdRuleResultsIn, MetricDefMeasureConsequenceDeterminedBy and the entity MetricDefMeasureThresholdConsequence are summarized through the derived association “/MetricDefMeasureThresholdRuleResultsIn” on the Figure Me.07a - Metric Threshold Definition - Derived Associations. Note: A derived association enables more synthetic views and is less accurate than the real detailed associations but has not to be implemented. The MetricDefMeasureThresholdRelationship enables specifying any kind of relationships between MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule such as depends on, follows, and so forth.

contents.name: Figure Me.07a - Metric Threshold Definition - Derived Associations
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Common Domain::Metric ABE::Metric Addendum Figures::Figure Me.07a - Metric Threshold Definition - Derived Associations

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.07a - Metric Threshold Definition - Derived Associations shows an overview of how threshold are specified for a MetricDefMeasure....

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.07a - Metric Threshold Definition - Derived Associations

ownedComment.body: Figure Me.07a - Metric Threshold Definition - Derived Associations shows an overview of how threshold are specified for a MetricDefMeasure. A MetricDefMeasure specifies a measure of a specific aspect of an entity, such as lost packets or dealer sales target achievement, defined for a MetricDefinition that may trigger consequence (s) (MetricDefMeasureConsequence) if a threshold (MetricDefMeasureThreshold) is crossed. A MetricDefMeasureThresholdSet provides a way to group a set of one or more MetricDefMeasureThresholdRules specifying the condition to evaluate for applying consequences. The thresholdType specifies the type of MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule contained in the MetricDefMeasureThresholdSet. The value is “LogicDefinition” if the MetricDefMeasureThresholdSet contains only MetricThresholdRuleDefinition instances and “PreDefined” if it contains only PreDefinedMetricThresholdRule instances. A MetricDefMeasureThresholdSet is used to evaluate one or more MetricDefMesures. Threshold rules (MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule) may differ in the condition that they apply, a raise condition or a clear condition, and in the severity of the threshold crossing. A MetricDefMeasureConsequence defines the action (prescribed action or notification) taken when a MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule is crossed and might depend on MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule applied or not for the previous MetricMeasure.. When a MetricDefMeasureConsequence is applied (track as a MetricMeasureConsequence) this is the result of a single rule (MetricDefMeasureThresholdRule) being crossed. Different consequences (MetricDefMeasureConsequence) can be defined for different severities. The repeatAction attribute on MetricDefMeasureConsequence is an indicator used to specify that a consequence • should cease being applied if a value is in the same range as the previous value • or continue being applied if a value is in the same range as the previous value. If the repeatApplication is True, the consequence is always applied as soon as the MetricMeasure value is in the range of values and if the repeatApplication is False, the consequence is applied only if the previous MetricMeasure value wasn’t in the same range. Nota: • The two associations pre-fixed by a slash correspond to derived associations. • A derived associations represents synthetically several associations. See example with the next figure Me – 07b.

contents.name: Figure Me.18 - Metric Observation
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Common Domain::Metric ABE::Metric Addendum Figures::Figure Me.18 - Metric Observation

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: A MetricMeasurementJob might be triggered by the schedule or might be triggered by a request from a PartyRole....

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Me.18 - Metric Observation

ownedComment.body: A MetricMeasurementJob might be triggered by the schedule or might be triggered by a request from a PartyRole. In both cases, a MetricMeasurementObservation tracks each measurement (i.e. execution of a MetricMeasurementJob). A MetricMeasurementObservation represents the contextual information of a measurement such as the observation period, the MetricMeasurementJob used, the requester of the observation (PartyRole) and the scope of the observation through the related MonitoredMetricObjectCriteria. The MonitoredMetricObjectCriteria related to MetricMeasurementObservation has to be equal to or a sub-set of the one related to the concerned MetricMeasurementJob. A MetricMeasurementObservation also specifies the MectricMeasures resulting from this observation.
